title: 111_s1603
content: The Act titled "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or "VETS Act of 2009" provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. The VETS Act of 2009 offers tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service, ensuring refunds for tuition and fees if withdrawal is due to military obligations. The VETS Act of 2009 provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service, including waivers for tuition and fees paid through scholarships or funds awarded by the institution, repayment waivers for withdrawals due to military service, and loan forgiveness options. On behalf of the student, loan assistance can be cancelled, including outstanding principle and accrued interest on loans awarded under part D or E. The PLUS loan awarded to a parent on behalf of the student can be cancelled, and the Secretary will reimburse institutions for cancelled Perkins loans. The Secretary will reimburse institutions for cancelled Perkins loans, minus loans made from Federal capital contributions. Funds from section 461(b) are not available for these payments, and payments should be made within 3 months of filing an application. Loan eligibility and limits for students are also addressed. The amendments made by this Act allow for forgiveness of loans for students who withdrew due to service in the uniformed services, without affecting their loan limits or eligibility for grants. The effective date for these changes is after the enactment of the Act. The term "period of service in the uniformed services" is defined as the time from 30 days before a student is required to report for service until they return from such service.
